title: Level 2 Statistics Practice Test
description: Test your skills with tally marks, picture graphs and describing chance!

questions.question: How many does this tally mark group represent? Two complete groups of 5 tallies plus 4 extra marks.
questions.explanation: Two complete groups of 5 = $5 + 5 = 10$, plus 4 extra marks = $10 + 4 = 14$.

questions.question: In a picture graph, apples have 6 pictures and bananas have 4 pictures. How many more students chose apples than bananas?
questions.explanation: The difference is $6 - 4 = 2$. Two more students chose apples than bananas.

questions.question: Which word best describes the chance of a coin landing on heads?
questions.explanation: A coin has two sides -- heads and tails. There's an equal chance of landing on either side, so it's an **even chance** (fifty-fifty).

questions.question: Which event is impossible?

options.text: You will find a real unicorn
A bird will fly over your house

questions.explanation: Unicorns are not real, so finding one is **impossible**. The other events could all happen.

questions.question: A survey shows: Red = 8 tally marks, Blue = 5 tally marks, Green = 3 tally marks. How many people were surveyed in total?
questions.explanation: Add all the totals: $8 + 5 + 3 = 16$ people were surveyed.

questions.question: A bag has 2 red balls and 8 blue balls. What is the chance of picking a red ball?
questions.explanation: Only 2 out of 10 balls are red, so picking red is **unlikely**. Most of the balls (8 out of 10) are blue.

questions.question: How many tally marks are in three complete groups of 5?
questions.explanation: Three groups of 5 tally marks: $5 + 5 + 5 = 15$. Or: $3 \times 5 = 15$.

questions.question: In a picture graph, cats have 9 pictures, dogs have 7 pictures and birds have 4 pictures. Which animal is the most popular?
questions.explanation: Cats have the most pictures (9), which means they are the most popular. $9 > 7 > 4$.

questions.question: Is it 'certain', 'likely', 'unlikely' or 'impossible' that the sun will set tonight?
questions.explanation: The sun sets every single day without fail. This is a **certain** event -- it will definitely happen.

questions.question: A class voted for their favourite sport. Soccer: 11 votes, Cricket: 8 votes, Swimming: 6 votes. How many students voted altogether?
questions.explanation: Add all the votes: $11 + 8 + 6 = 25$ students voted.
